detail_description: Deolo is home to the iconic Morgan House, a stunning ivy-clad mansion built in the 1930s by English jute baron George Morgan. Situated on Durpin Dara, which translates to 'binocular hill' in Nepali, this historic property offers a perfect hilltop location with captivating views. Legend has it that the late Mrs. Morgan still roams the house, adding an intriguing ghost story to its allure.
name: Deolo
address: Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

detail_description: Pine View Nursery, also known as the Kalimpong Cactus Nursery or Mohanji nursery, is a must-visit attraction in Kalimpong. Founded by Mr. Mohan S Pradhan, this unique nursery boasts an extensive collection of over 1500 species of cacti and succulents from around the world, making it the largest cacti collection in Asia.
name: Pine View Nursery
address: 3F64+QJ9, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Sprawling Hindu temple complex noted for its landscaped garden, ornate statues & colorful sanctuary.
detail_description: Mangal Dham Temple, located in Kalimpong, West Bengal, is a sprawling Hindu temple complex known for its landscaped garden, ornate statues, and colorful sanctuary. Built in 1993 to honor the late guru Shri Mangaldasji by Shri Krishna Pranami, it is a significant religious center in the region.
name: Mangal Dham Temple
address: 3FCG+XP9, Relli Rd, Strawberry, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

detail_description: Located in the expansive Big Dhara region of Kalimpong, the Lepcha Museum serves as a prominent attraction that offers an insight into the rich heritage and culture of the Lepcha tribe. This unique museum, established by respected musician and social worker Shri Sonam Lepcha, effectively preserves and promotes the values and identity of this indigenous community.
name: Lepcha Museum
address: 3F7C+8X6, H.L Dixit Rd, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: The Kalimpong Science Centre is a popular destination for families, offering interactive exhibits and shows on science and technology. It provides an educational and entertaining experience for visitors of all ages, with hands-on activities and multimedia presentations covering various scientific concepts such as astronomy, biology, and physics. The center's serene atmosphere and pleasant climate make it an enjoyable place to explore with loved ones.
name: Kalimpong Science Centre
address: 3GQ6+24C, P. O, Deolo, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Geden Tharpa Choling Monastery is one of the must-visit attractions in Kalimpong, offering a serene and awe-inspiring experience. The monastery boasts a huge golden Buddha statue facing the city, creating a stunning backdrop against the panoramic view. Visitors can also explore the beautifully designed building adorned with intricate paintings and housing numerous ancient manuscripts. Additionally, there is a museum on the premises featuring an array of ancient artifacts and relics.
name: Geden Tharpa Choling Monastery
address: 3FHJ+GV6, Bapai Road, Tirpai, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

detail_description: Dr. Graham's Homes School, founded by a Scottish missionary in the late 19th century, is a significant heritage site in Kalimpong. It was established to provide education and shelter to abandoned children, many of whom were born to European fathers and Indian mothers. The serene campus offers an opportunity for leisurely strolls and a glimpse into local life at Damber Chowk.
name: Dr. Graham's Homes School
address: 3FMR+CVH, Topkhana, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

excerpt: 1372m-peak topped by a Buddhist monastery as well as offering views of Kalimpong & the Himalaya.
detail_description: Durpin, a 1372-meter peak in Kalimpong, is home to the Durpin Monastery and offers breathtaking views of Kalimpong and the Himalayas. The monastery, consecrated by the Dalai Lama himself, is adorned with beautiful paintings and rare Tibetan scripts. Colorful Buddhist prayer flags flutter in the wind, creating a peaceful atmosphere. Other nearby attractions include the Army Golf Course, Morgan House, and Zang Dhok Palri Phodang Monastery.
name: Durpin
address: Chandraloke, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Sacred hilltop Buddhist monastery consecrated by the Dalai Lama & offering panoramic views.
detail_description: Perched on a sacred hilltop, The Zang Dhok Palri Monastery, also known as the Durpin Monastery, is a renowned Buddhist site in Kalimpong. Consecrated by the Dalai Lama in 1976, it houses rare 108 volumes of Kangyur brought from Tibet. The monastery offers breathtaking panoramic views of Kalimpong town, surrounding forests, and Mount Kanchenjunga on clear days.
name: The Zang Dhok Palri Monastery
address: 2FQ6+775, E Main Rd, Chandraloke, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Kalimpong is an east Indian hill town in the Himalayan foothills of West Bengal. Perched on a ridge above the Teesta River, it’s home to colonial-era buildings like MacFarlane Memorial Church, named after a Scottish missionary. South, the hilltop Durpin Monastery, or Zang Dhok Palri Phodang, contains sacred Buddhist scriptures. Deolo Park has landscaped gardens and offers views of the town and surrounding hills.
detail_description: Nestled in the Himalayan foothills of West Bengal, Kalimpong is a charming hill town with colonial-era architecture and breathtaking views. The MacFarlane Memorial Church and Durpin Monastery are notable landmarks, while Deolo Park offers beautifully landscaped gardens and panoramic vistas. Surrounded by Deolo Hill and Durpin Hill, this mystical destination boasts a salubrious climate and a wealth of attractions for travelers seeking an offbeat experience.
name: Kalimpong
address: West Bengal, India

detail_description: Haat Bazaar, a bi-weekly farmer's market in Kalimpong, is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. Here you can find an array of goods including spices, vegetables, fish, prawns, clothes, cutlery, and flowers. The market also showcases locally made products such as homemade snacks like phungbi and alu thukpa.
name: हाट‌ बजार Haat Bazaar
address: Haat, bazar, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Perched atop Durpin Hill, the Durpin Monastery, also known as ZangDhokPalri Monastery, boasts stunning architecture that immediately captures your attention upon arrival. This monastery in Kalimpong offers not only spiritual tranquility but also breathtaking panoramic views of the Himalayas and the meandering Teesta River. Visitors can witness Buddhist monks engaging in worship rituals, providing a unique and fulfilling experience.
name: Durpin Monastery
address: 2FQ6+775, E Main Rd, Chandraloke, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Built 1891, this church is dedicated to William Macfarlane, the first missionary to visit Kalimpong.
detail_description: MacFarlane Memorial Church, constructed in 1891 by Scottish missionaries, is a stunning architectural marvel situated on elevated land in Kalimpong. The church is dedicated to William Macfarlane, the first missionary to visit the area. Its Gothic Revival style and towering steeple make it a distinctive feature of Kalimpong's skyline.
name: MacFarlane Memorial Church
address: KD Pradhan Rd, Chotta Bhalukhop, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: The LAVA viewpoint is a breathtaking destination that offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. Nestled in a picturesque location, it provides visitors with an opportunity to immerse themselves in nature's beauty while enjoying the serene atmosphere. The vantage point is perfect for photography enthusiasts and those seeking a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Whether you're hiking to reach this scenic spot or simply relaxing at the top, LAVA viewpoint promises an unforgettable experience filled with awe-inspiring sights and tranquility.
name: LAVA view point
address: 3F59+PQW, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Park atop Deolo Hill featuring mountain views, hang gliding, landscaped gardens & picnic spots.
detail_description: Delo Park, perched atop the stunning Delo Hill at an elevation of 1,704 meters, is a must-visit destination in Kalimpong. This picturesque park offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and the serene River Teesta. As you wander through its beautifully landscaped gardens adorned with vibrant flowering plants and shrubs, you'll find plenty of picnic spots to relax and soak in nature's beauty.
name: Delo Park
address: 3GQ3+M83, Deolo, Homes St.And Graihms, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

name: 7th Mile View Point
address: 3CCW+CW8, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Perched on Deoli Hills, the Hanuman temple boasts the tallest statue of Hanumanji in northeast India. It's a popular pit stop for travelers en route to other nearby attractions. Visitors rave about the stunning views and tranquil atmosphere, making it an ideal escape from urban life. The temple offers a serene setting to immerse oneself in nature and marvel at the breathtaking sight of clouds enveloping the colossal statue.
name: Hanuman temple
address: 3F5C+M75, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

excerpt: Small museum with dioramas & exhibits on local ecological life & human effects on the environment.
detail_description: Forest Museum, also known as the Nature Interpretation Center, is a small but informative museum located near Kalimpong college and police station. Managed by the forest department, it features dioramas and exhibits showcasing local ecological life and human impacts on the environment. Visitors can explore stuffed animals, skins of tigers and leopards, as well as various statues depicting hill people's lifestyle. The museum also displays photographs of different species with descriptions of their lifestyles.
name: Forest Museum
address: 3F69+P9P, Rinkinpong Rd, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: China Garden Restaurant and Lodge is a popular spot in Kalimpong, known for its top-class Chinese cuisine. The restaurant is famous for its signature dish, Mei Foon, and exclusive Chicken Drumsticks that attract both locals and visitors. Conveniently located next to the taxi stand in the heart of town, it offers well-maintained rooms with a very supportive staff. Although parking space may be limited, the accommodating owners ensure a warm and cooperative stay.
name: China Garden Restaurent and Lodge
address: Lal Gulli, DS Gurung Rd, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Teesta River Rafting is a popular adventure sport in Kalimpong, West Bengal. The river has become a hotspot for white water rafting in eastern India and is a must-try activity during a visit to Kalimpong. With its green surroundings and deep ravines, Teesta River offers an exhilarating experience for rafters.
name: Teesta River Rafting
address: Teesta Bridge, Chitrey, Tista Bazar, Mangber Forest, West Bengal 734312, India

detail_description: Samthar is a charming destination that promises unforgettable experiences. The plateau provides stunning views of Mt. Kanchenjangha, creating a picturesque backdrop for activities like biking and hiking. It's an ideal place to create lasting memories with friends and loved ones.
name: Samthar
address: 3FC9+2Q5, Chotta Bhalukhop, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India

detail_description: Ramdhura is a beloved destination for travelers seeking to immerse themselves in the natural splendor and rustic charm of the area. It's renowned for its picturesque landscapes and cozy homestays, making it an ideal retreat for nature enthusiasts.
name: ramdhura
address: 3GM8+J45, Deolo, Dalapchan Ridge Reserve Forest, West Bengal 734316, India

detail_description: Kalimpong Nursery is home to a diverse collection of over 100 indigenous and international cactus species, all carefully preserved in excellent conditions. The unique shapes and sizes of the plants are sure to captivate any visitor's interest. A visit to this nursery is a must during your Kalimpong vacation for an unforgettable experience.
name: Kalimpong Nursery
address: Dr BL Dixit Rd, Chandraloke, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

name: Kalimpong view point
address: 3F59+PQW, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

name: Hanuman Mandir
address: Hanuman Temple, Kalimpong, Dalapchan Ridge Reserve Forest, West Bengal 734316, India

excerpt: Global eats & coffee served in an open, bohemian-style venue featuring a terrace & mountain views.
detail_description: Art Cafe in Kalimpong is a bohemian-style venue located on a hillside, offering global cuisine and coffee with stunning mountain views. Founded by local residents, Pravesh Chhetri and Yachna Rizal, this cafe features an adaptable design with indoor and outdoor seating. The open-air space provides a picturesque view of the Kanchenjunga along with light jazz music in the background.
name: Art Cafe
address: Rishi Rd, Chotta Bhalukhop, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: When exploring the culinary scene in Kalimpong, one cannot overlook Fresh Bites. This charming eatery offers a delightful array of international dishes, blending both Indian and continental flavors that are sure to tantalize your taste buds. It's not just about the food; Fresh Bites is also an inviting spot for friends to gather and unwind, making it perfect for long conversations over delicious meals.
name: Fresh Bites
address: Rishi Rd, Mongbol Busty, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Gouripur House in Kalimpong is a captivating glimpse into the town's colonial past, offering a valuable addition to any travel itinerary. Despite its historical significance and architectural beauty, finding the location can be challenging due to the lack of signage. The house is situated on sprawling land and while it offers a good experience, it requires immediate maintenance and refurbishment. This heritage building stands as a testament to North Bengal's history but needs government support for preservation.
name: Gouripur House, Kalimpong
address: 3F57+P43, Upper Cart Rd, below hilltop hotel, behind Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Kalimpong, St. Theresa Catholic Church is a remarkable architectural gem that beautifully reflects the region's rich multicultural heritage. Constructed in 1929 by Swiss Jesuits, this church stands out for its unique design inspired by Buddhist Gompa architecture. The stunning stained-glass windows and intricately carved wooden walls depict biblical scenes with figures reminiscent of Buddhist monks, showcasing an intriguing blend of Tibetan influences. As the largest Roman Catholic Church in the area, St.
name: St. Theresa Catholic Church
address: 3F83+2X8, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

name: Jelepla view point
address: durpin heliport, durpin, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Crookety House, the final residence of Helena Roerich following her husband's passing, now stands as a museum exhibiting Roerich's artwork and serving as the headquarters for the Agni Yoga Society that she established. Additionally, Dr. Grahams Homes, founded by a Scottish missionary to provide education and care for abandoned children with European-Indian heritage, offers a tranquil and expansive campus ideal for leisurely walks. The area is praised for its organic development and serene ambiance.
name: Crookety House
address: 3F47+C2Q, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Dharmodaya Vihar, located in Kalimpong, is a serene and peaceful place that offers stunning views of the mountains and the town's church. It holds nostalgic memories for many visitors who recall it as their childhood school or a nearby house they used to visit. The area is surrounded by tourist attractions such as monasteries, colonial bungalows, and view points offering panoramic snow-capped mountain vistas.
name: Dharmodaya Vihar/ School
address: Dharmodaya Vihar, Kalimpong Khasmahal, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734301, India

detail_description: Tongsa Gumba, also known as the oldest Bhutanese Monastery in the area, was originally built in the 16th century but has since been reconstructed. Visitors have the opportunity to witness prayer services conducted by monks at this serene and peaceful location. The monastery is adorned with breathtaking thangka paintings and murals that add to its historical richness.
name: Tongsa Gumba
address: 3FFH+XGR, Lower Gumba Hatta, Kalimpong, West Bengal 734316, India
